page.title: 02HOW CAPLE FABRICS
page.content: {How Caple Court}is a large house dating from{1200,}with{1000 acres. The{stables}have been converted by the owner, a director of an{Austrian firm called{Otten Textiles,}into a{shop. The textiles used to be stored in {London,}but{costs}made the firm store them here; {friends and neighbours wanted to buy them, so the shop was opened. The textiles are mostly {cottons}from{Austria, Yugoslavia and {Hong Kong,}and are sold to the{House {of Fraser, Jaeger, Marks and Spencer, and countries like{France and Ireland. Customers come from as far as{Bath, {Bristol and Cheltenham}because the {quality,}the{choice,}and the{prices are excellent. Many of them use {local seamstresses}to have their fabric made into clothes. The shop is{very successful. }They are opening a{plant nursery}and plan a{tea room.
